messages.content: What is the purpose of comfyui_LLM_schools?
comfyui_LLM_schools is a ComfyUI extension that supports full fine-tuning of AutoModelForCausalLM classes in the transformer library.
Which workflow is used as a reference in comfyui_LLM_schools?
The workflow used as a reference in comfyui_LLM_schools is The_first_training.json.
Is comfyui_LLM_schools available in English?
Yes, comfyui_LLM_schools is available in English as indicated by the 'English' badge in the documentation.
Is comfyui_LLM_schools available in Chinese?
Yes, comfyui_LLM_schools is available in Simplified Chinese as indicated by the '简体中文' badge in the documentation.
Does comfyui_LLM_schools support fine-tuning of other model classes besides AutoModelForCausalLM?
The documentation only mentions support for full fine-tuning of AutoModelForCausalLM classes. It does not specify support for other model classes.
Can comfyui_LLM_schools be used for image generation?
The documentation does not mention any functionality related to image generation. It appears to be focused on language model fine-tuning.
Is comfyui_LLM_schools a standalone application or an extension?
comfyui_LLM_schools is an extension for ComfyUI, not a standalone application.
What is the purpose of the comfyui_LLM_schools project?
The comfyui_LLM_schools project aims to provide a GUI for fine-tuning large language models using the transformer library.
Which class from the transformer library is currently supported by comfyui_LLM_schools for fine-tuning?
The comfyui_LLM_schools project currently supports the AutoModelForCausalLM class from the transformer library for full fine-tuning.
Is there a reference workflow available for fine-tuning in comfyui_LLM_schools?
Yes, there is a reference workflow named 'The_first_training' available in the workflow directory for fine-tuning in comfyui_LLM_schools.
In which directory can the reference workflow for fine-tuning be found?
The reference workflow for fine-tuning, named 'The_first_training.json', can be found in the 'workflow' directory of the comfyui_LLM_schools project.
Does the comfyui_LLM_schools project support languages other than English?
Yes, the comfyui_LLM_schools project supports Simplified Chinese language in addition to English, as indicated by the README files in both languages.
What is the file format of the reference workflow for fine-tuning in comfyui_LLM_schools?
The reference workflow for fine-tuning in comfyui_LLM_schools is provided in JSON format, as indicated by the '.json' file extension.
How can one access the documentation for the comfyui_LLM_schools project?
The documentation for the comfyui_LLM_schools project can be accessed by clicking on the shields labeled 'English' or '简体中文' which link to the respective README files.
